name: DATADOG__GET_METRICS
description: Query metrics from Datadog using the metrics API. This allows retrieving time series data for monitoring and analysis of application and infrastructure performance.

from.description: Start time as Unix timestamp (seconds since epoch)

to.description: End time as Unix timestamp (seconds since epoch)

name: DATADOG__LIST_ACTIVE_METRICS
description: List active metrics in Datadog from the last hour. This helps discover available metrics for monitoring and alerting.

from.description: Start time as Unix timestamp (defaults to 1 hour ago)

name: DATADOG__GET_METRIC_METADATA
description: Get metadata for a specific metric including description, type, unit, and per_unit information.

name: DATADOG__UPDATE_METRIC_METADATA
description: Update metadata for a custom metric including description, type, and unit information. This helps with metric documentation and organization.

description.description: Description of what the metric measures

short_name.description: A short name for the metric

per_unit.description: Per unit for rate metrics (e.g., 'second' for 'requests per second')

name: DATADOG__SUBMIT_METRICS
description: Submit custom metrics to Datadog. This allows sending application and business metrics for monitoring and alerting.

series.description: Array of metric series to submit

tags.description: Tags to associate with the metric (e.g., ['env:prod', 'service:api'])

interval.description: Interval in seconds between metric points

name: DATADOG__LIST_DASHBOARDS
description: List all dashboards in Datadog including timeboards and screenboards for monitoring visualization and analysis.

count.description: Maximum number of dashboards to return

name: DATADOG__GET_DASHBOARD
description: Get detailed information about a specific Datadog dashboard including widgets, layout, and configuration.

name: DATADOG__CREATE_DASHBOARD
description: Create a new dashboard in Datadog for monitoring and visualization. This allows building custom monitoring views for teams and applications.

notify_list.description: List of email addresses or @mentions to notify on dashboard changes

template_variables.description: Dashboard template variables for dynamic filtering

definition.description: Widget definition including type and requests

name: DATADOG__UPDATE_DASHBOARD
description: Update an existing Datadog dashboard including title, widgets, and configuration. This allows modifying monitoring views and visualizations.

dashboard_id.description: The ID of the dashboard to update

name: DATADOG__DELETE_DASHBOARD
description: Delete a Datadog dashboard. This permanently removes the dashboard and its configuration.

dashboard_id.description: The ID of the dashboard to delete

name: DATADOG__LIST_MONITORS
description: List monitors in Datadog for alerting and notification management. Monitors define conditions that trigger alerts when thresholds are met.

with_downtimes.description: Include monitors that have associated downtimes

name: DATADOG__GET_MONITOR
description: Get detailed information about a specific Datadog monitor including configuration, thresholds, and current status.

group_states.description: Comma-separated list of group states to include

name: DATADOG__CREATE_MONITOR
description: Create a new monitor in Datadog for alerting on metric thresholds, anomalies, or conditions. This enables proactive monitoring and incident response.

message.description: Message to include with notifications, supports @mentions

tags.description: Tags to associate with the monitor

timeout_h.description: Hours after which monitor will timeout

require_full_window.description: Require full evaluation window for alerting

notify_no_data.description: Notify when monitor stops receiving data

priority.description: Monitor priority (1-5, where 1 is highest priority)

name: DATADOG__UPDATE_MONITOR
description: Update an existing Datadog monitor configuration including query, thresholds, and notification settings.

monitor_id.description: The ID of the monitor to update

name: DATADOG__DELETE_MONITOR
description: Delete a Datadog monitor. This permanently removes the monitor and stops all associated alerting.

monitor_id.description: The ID of the monitor to delete

force.description: Force deletion even if monitor has dependencies

name: DATADOG__MUTE_MONITOR
description: Mute a Datadog monitor to temporarily disable alerting. This is useful during maintenance or when alerts are expected.

monitor_id.description: The ID of the monitor to mute

scope.description: Scope of the mute (e.g., 'host:web01' or '*' for all)

end.description: Unix timestamp when mute should end (optional, permanent mute if omitted)

name: DATADOG__UNMUTE_MONITOR
description: Unmute a previously muted Datadog monitor to restore alerting functionality.

monitor_id.description: The ID of the monitor to unmute

scope.description: Scope to unmute (e.g., 'host:web01' or '*' for all)

all_scopes.description: Unmute all scopes for the monitor

name: DATADOG__LIST_HOSTS
description: List hosts reporting to Datadog including metadata, tags, and last seen information for infrastructure monitoring.

count.description: Maximum number of hosts to return

from.description: Unix timestamp for filtering hosts that reported after this time

name: DATADOG__GET_HOST
description: Get detailed information about a specific host including metadata, tags, and metrics for infrastructure monitoring and troubleshooting.

host_name.description: The hostname to retrieve information for

from.description: Unix timestamp for historical data start

source.description: Source of the host data (agent, aws, etc.)

name: DATADOG__SEARCH_LOGS
description: Search logs in Datadog using queries and filters. This allows analyzing log data for troubleshooting, monitoring, and security analysis.

limit.description: Maximum number of logs to return

name: DATADOG__LIST_DOWNTIMES
description: List scheduled downtimes in Datadog that suppress monitor alerts during maintenance windows or planned outages.

name: DATADOG__CREATE_DOWNTIME
description: Schedule a downtime in Datadog to suppress monitor alerts during maintenance or planned outages. This prevents false alerts during known issues.

scope.description: Scope of the downtime (tags, host names, service names)

start.description: Unix timestamp when downtime starts (optional, defaults to now)

end.description: Unix timestamp when downtime ends (optional for indefinite downtime)

monitor_id.description: Specific monitor ID to mute (optional, omit to mute all monitors matching scope)

monitor_tags.description: Monitor tags to match for muting

mute_first_recovery_notification.description: Mute the first recovery notification during downtime

name: DATADOG__UPDATE_DOWNTIME
description: Update an existing Datadog downtime including scope, time period, and message. This allows modifying planned maintenance windows.

downtime_id.description: The ID of the downtime to update

start.description: Updated start time as Unix timestamp

end.description: Updated end time as Unix timestamp

name: DATADOG__CANCEL_DOWNTIME
description: Cancel an active or scheduled Datadog downtime to restore normal monitor alerting functionality.

downtime_id.description: The ID of the downtime to cancel

name: DATADOG__LIST_TAGS
description: List all tags available in Datadog for filtering and grouping hosts, metrics, and other resources.

name: DATADOG__GET_HOST_TAGS
description: Get tags for a specific host in Datadog. This shows how the host is categorized and can be used for filtering and monitoring.

host_name.description: The hostname to retrieve tags for

source.description: Source of the tags to retrieve

name: DATADOG__UPDATE_HOST_TAGS
description: Update tags for a specific host in Datadog. This allows managing host categorization and organization for monitoring and filtering.

host_name.description: The hostname to update tags for

tags.description: Array of tags to assign to the host (replaces existing tags)

name: DATADOG__CREATE_EVENT
description: Create an event in Datadog to track deployments, incidents, or other important occurrences. Events appear on dashboards and can trigger notifications.

text.description: Text content of the event (supports markdown)

date_happened.description: Unix timestamp when event occurred (defaults to now)

source_type_name.description: Source type that generated the event

device_name.description: Device name associated with the event

tags.description: Tags to associate with the event

name: DATADOG__LIST_EVENTS
description: List events in Datadog with filtering options by time, priority, sources, and tags for event timeline analysis.

start.description: Unix timestamp for start of search range

end.description: Unix timestamp for end of search range

tags.description: Comma-separated list of tags to filter by

name: DATADOG__GET_EVENT
description: Get detailed information about a specific Datadog event including content, metadata, and associated resources.

name: DATADOG__LIST_SERVICE_DEPENDENCIES
description: List service dependencies in Datadog APM to understand service relationships and communication patterns for application monitoring.

start.description: Unix timestamp for start of analysis period

end.description: Unix timestamp for end of analysis period

name: DATADOG__LIST_SERVICES
description: List services monitored by Datadog APM including performance metrics and service catalog information for application observability.

start.description: Unix timestamp for start of analysis period

end.description: Unix timestamp for end of analysis period

service.description: Specific service name to filter by

name: DATADOG__GET_SERVICE_PERFORMANCE
description: Get performance statistics for a specific service including latency, throughput, and error rates from Datadog APM.

start.description: Unix timestamp for start of analysis period

end.description: Unix timestamp for end of analysis period

name: DATADOG__CREATE_SYNTHETICS_TEST
description: Create a synthetic test in Datadog for monitoring website or API availability and performance from multiple global locations.

timeout.description: Timeout for the request in seconds

tick_every.description: Frequency of test execution in seconds

message.description: Message for notifications when test fails

tags.description: Tags to associate with the test

name: DATADOG__LIST_SYNTHETICS_TESTS
description: List all synthetic tests configured in Datadog for monitoring website and API availability across global locations.

page_size.description: Number of tests to return per page

name: DATADOG__GET_SYNTHETICS_TEST
description: Get detailed information about a specific synthetic test including configuration, locations, and recent results.

public_id.description: The public ID of the synthetic test

name: DATADOG__DELETE_SYNTHETICS_TEST
description: Delete a synthetic test from Datadog. This permanently removes the test and stops monitoring from all configured locations.

public_id.description: The public ID of the synthetic test to delete
